snippet: The family of Reynaldo Cuevas, accidentally killed by an officer on Friday as he fled a bodega holdup, wants to know if the shooting was a criminal act.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column asserts that Reynaldo Cuevas, who was accidentally killed by a New York City Police Officer as he fled a bodega holdup, is not the victim of manslaughter or reckless endangerment; argues that the blame for this death lies squarely with the men who robbed the store, not the officer who came to help.
lead_paragraph: The family of Reynaldo Cuevas, accidentally killed by an officer on Friday as he fled a bodega holdup, wants to know if the shooting was a criminal act.

headline.seo: Fatal Police Shooting Outside Bodega Prompts Search for Blame
headline.main: Laying Bare the Roots of a Shooting Outside a Bodega
headline.print_headline: Laying Bare the Roots of a Shooting Outside a Bodega
